评论概述: Wow way smaller than the size chart
评论详情: Okay I was excited to get these they are great made and look really nice! well the only problem is they don't fit me... I ordered 3x because it said the size was 50+ for the waist and I'm only 44 in the waist. I'm about 6'2" or 6'3"  270 lb... I got them on but it was quite tight in the chest. The waist part that has a elastic band was up over my stomach (I don't wear pants that way) and when I tried to raise my hands over my head well let's just say the crotch area had no room and I couldn't get my hands completely over my head. I got them today and test fit and started the return. I really wish they made 4x or 5x I think if this is what they consider 3x I probably need a 5x in their sizes. It kind of saddens me because I was really looking forward to getting these, the last pair I've had were Dickies and it was quite a while ago and I could put them on over my work boots and everything. Guess I will be looking for some of those. If you're not over 6 ft tall and over 250 they may fit you okay I mainly got these to crawl up under houses when I'm working on people's heat and air but I couldn't see trying to crawl in these being so tight.

I did not buy these to look great in them but that doesn't stop ppl from asking  about them and giving me their unsolicited reviews.  They are comfortable and color fast. Having been through the meatgrinder with failed coverall attempts over the last five decades I gave up on them. However my grandsons are of an age where they benefit from some exposure to the kind of heavy industrial work that I made a career of. That put me back in the trenches cutting, welding, grinding, rigging, basically destroying my regular attire.  Reenter the coverall.  These work. They fit my XXXL frame (with some compromises like legs too long but hey, this isn't custom tailored haberdashery for the Met crowd). They do suffer but don't explode in the presence of a few paltry thousand degrees of hot weld splatter and they don't break the bank.  Are they worth it?  I just ordered two more pair.

I was surprised at the quality of these. I do mostly light work and these are perfect. Lots of crawling through damp crawl spaces under the house.  Sometimes products made in China seem flimsy, but not these. I'd only advise that I'm a "regular large" and they fit well. However, guys, be honest about your girth and if you're a bit larger than you think you might want to measure your waist before buying.
